results.title: Sex & Zen (E)
results.creator_credit: Michael Mak, Johnny Mak, Johnny Mak Production Ltd and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Based on the book “The Carnal prayer mat” which was banned for 400 years, this is a bawdy tale of the sexual adventures of a monk during the Ming Dynasty. Sexually explicit, this is considered to be on of China’s greatest erotic sagas. Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles. NOTE: At times the subtitles are difficult to read, this is due to the way the print has been filmed.

results.title: Fiona Hall. After 200 years
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two 30 minute episodes: 1. “Fiona Hall” Interview with Adelaide photographic artist, Fiona Hall. She discusses the aims and symbolism of her photo-collages and wide format photography. 2. “After 200 Years” A program on the Bicentennial project, co-ordinated by Penny Taylor, to commission twenty Australian photographers to document the diversity of Australian Aboriginal and Islander lifestyles in the ‘80s.

results.title: Vitalogy
results.creator_credit: Greg Williams, Clare Sawyer and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Lissa is intrigued by the odd behaviour of new next door neighbours. Her curiosity grows into sexual attraction for Michael the awkward son, who although he performs a weird foot washing ritual at night, is virile and shares an increased sexuality with the onset of adolescence. Two worlds collide and the rituals of ‘vitalogy’ become unstuck as illness forces the new neighbours to face a different world. Cast includes Tenley Gilmore as the cool and confident Lissa and Stephen Pilkington as Michael (with Margot Knight and Brian Lipson). Winner Best Australian Short Comedy Melbourne International Film Festival 1991.

results.title: Grant Mudford. Max Pam
results.creator_credit: Roger Young, Jeff Atkinson, Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two thirty minute programs: 1. “Grant Mudford” Born in Australia in 1944, photographer, Grant Mudford, now lives and works in California. He prefers anonymous architectural subject matter photographed in a manner that transforms it. 2. “Max Pam” Born in Melbourne, Max Pam left at age 19 for Katmandu. He returned to Australia in 1984 having established an international reputation as a photographer of Asia. Photography, for Pam, has the capacity to capture certain moments which elude the writer, the filmmaker or the painter.

results.title: Seventeen
results.creator_credit: Jeff Kreines, Joel DeMott, Kreines Films and DeMott
results.brief_description: A group of American working-class teenagers were filmed during their last year at high school. DeMott and Kreines filmed for more than a year and by living where they filmed, they covered a wide range of adolescent experiences. No cuts were made and the film reflects exactly what they saw.
